name: Environmental Protection Agency
description: The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA or sometimes USEPA) is an agency of the U.S. federal government which was created for the purpose of protecting human health and the environment by writing and enforcing regulations based on laws passed by Congress. The EPA was proposed by President Richard Nixon and began operation on December 2, 1970, after Nixon signed an executive order. The order establishing the EPA was ratified by committee hearings in the House and Senate. The agency is led by its Administrator, who is appointed by the president and approved by Congress. The current administrator is Gina McCarthy. The EPA is not a Cabinet department, but the administrator is normally given cabinet rank.

apis.name: Environmental Protection Agency
apis.description: The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA or sometimes USEPA) is an agency of the U.S. federal government which was created for the purpose of protecting human health and the environment by writing and enforcing regulations based on laws passed by Congress. The EPA was proposed by President Richard Nixon and began operation on December 2, 1970, after Nixon signed an executive order. The order establishing the EPA was ratified by committee hearings in the House and Senate. The agency is led by its Administrator, who is appointed by the president and approved by Congress. The current administrator is Gina McCarthy. The EPA is not a Cabinet department, but the administrator is normally given cabinet rank.

apis.name: EPA Air Facility System (AFS) API
apis.description: Air Facility System (AFS) provides permit emissions and compliance data on air pollution point sources.

apis.name: EPA Biennial Report API
apis.description: The Biennial Report is a national system that collects data on the generation, management, and minimization of hazardous wast

apis.name: EPA Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Information System API
apis.description: The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Information System provides information about Superfund (cleaning/removal of hazardous waste) sites, from discovery to their listing on the National Priorities list.

apis.name: EPA Facility Registry System API
apis.description: The Facility Registry System provides facility identification information via facility linkages across several program systems.

apis.name: EPA Greenhouse Gas API
apis.description: The program requires annual reporting of greenhouse gas (GHG) data and other relevant information from large direct emissions sources and suppliers of certain fossil fuels and industrial gases in the United States.

apis.name: EPA Integrated Grants Management System API
EPA Radiation Ambient Monitoring API
apis.description: Formerly, Environmental Radiation Ambient Monitoring System (ERAMS), provides data from a national network of monitoring stations that collect air, precipitation, drinking water, and milk samples for analysis of radioactivity.

apis.name: EPA Radiation Information Database API
apis.description: The Radiation Information Database provides information aobut certain facilities that EPA regulates for radiation and radioactivity.

apis.name: EPA Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information API
apis.description: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information provides information about nationwide hazardous waste handlers.

apis.name: EPA Safe Drinking Water Information System API
apis.description: Safe Drinking Water Information System provides information on water system violations of EPAs drinking water regulations.

apis.name: EPA Toxics Release Inventory API
apis.description: Toxics Release Inventory contains information about the annual release of toxic chemicals to the air, land, and water.
